subject: Languages
title: DeafBlind Communication
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: DeafBlind Communication.

hook.text: How do you communicate when you can neither hear nor see? DeafBlind people have found extraordinary ways.

buildup.text: Helen Keller is the most famous DeafBlind person, but thousands live full communicative lives.

discovery.text: Tactile signing ‚Äî feeling signs in the hands ‚Äî lets DeafBlind people 'hear' sign language by touch.

twist.text: Pro-tactile ASL, developed by DeafBlind people themselves, uses touch on the body for information.

climax.text: DeafBlind communities prove that the human drive to communicate overcomes any sensory barrier.

punchline.text: Language doesn't need eyes or ears. It just needs the will to connect.

quiz.question: What is tactile signing?
options: Feeling sign language by touching the signer's hands
